text:
- [Narrator] Web applications
and APIs face security risks

that can cause downtime or
consume excess resources.
AWS WAF is a web application firewall

that protects against
common web exploits and bots

that may affect availability,
compromise security,
or consume excessive resources.

You can deploy it with a few
clicks on Amazon CloudFront

and Application Load Balancer
to protect your applications,

whether they run in the
cloud or on-premises.

Quickly get started using
Managed Rules for AWS WAF,
which includes pre-configured rules
for the OWASP top 10 security risks

and protection against common
and pervasive bot traffic.

You can customize an existing
rule or create your own
to filter out specific traffic patterns.

AWS WAF offers near
real-time traffic visibility
through Amazon CloudWatch metrics,

where you can log each inspected
web request header data

for security automation,
analytics, or auditing purposes.
Using AWS Firewall Manager and AWS WAF's

fast rule propagation,
you can easily and quickly

deploy protections
across your organization

to keep your applications and
APIs available and protected.
Get started today with AWS WAF.
